chapter.para: To build a Groovy project, you use the Groovy Plugin. This plugin extends the Java plugin, adding Groovy compilation capabilties to your project. See . To use the Groovy plugin, add the following to your build file:
This will also apply the Java plugin to the project.

The Groovy plugin extends the compile task to include src/main/groovy and src/test/groovy source directories. Joint compilation is used for these directories, so they can contain both java and groovy source files.
You must declare the Groovy version to use, and where to find it. You do this by adding a dependency to the groovy configuration. For our sample, we will use Groovy 1.6.0 from the Maven repository:
